page.title: 06Costessey Churches
page.content: Nowadays, many people do not go to church except for special occasions. However, there are several thriving churches in Costessey. In the village, there is St Edmunds, the Anglican Parish Church, and a Baptist Chapel, both on The Street. As Lord Stafford's family, the Jerninghams, were Catholics, the village has a Catholic tradition, and a fair-sized church, St Walstans. On Norwich Road, there is a modern Methodist chapel, in New Costessey, and a modern Anglican church, St Helens, on Gurney Road. We finish off with Hebron Hall, a non-denominational chapel, on Sunny Grove, and a congregation which meets in Breckland Hall, on Gurney Road.
